Name: treatment of wastewater from ground granulated blast furnace slag production, wastewater treatment | wastewater from ground granulated blast furnace slag production | EN15804GD, U
Category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/37:Sewerage/370:Sewerage/3700:Sewerage
Description: This is an inventory for the disposal of a selected wastewater in United States. The reference unit is 1 m3 wastewater input. This activity represents the treatment of a specific wastewater in a WWT plant (while direct emissions and sewering are heeded in the upstream market dataset for this wastewater). The size of the treatment plant infrastructure is for a national average territory situation. The assumed size of the WWTP treats 112 Mio m3 per year. The mixture of WWTP with one, two, or three stages is 0%-20%-80%. The actual, waste-specific oxygen requirement in the biological stages is 0.00417546 kg O. The digestion process produces 3.42301 litres of biogas with an energy content of 0.0756488MJ. 45% of the biogas is utilized for energy. The remainder is flared. The gross electric efficiency is 26.564%. The gross thermal efficiency is 47.853%. After digestion, the remaining total sludge mass (dry matter) is 0.006406kg DM.
